medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms began three years prior to evaluation, with the development of painful nodules on her posterior neck and scalp. Over the next 15 months, these lesions persisted, and additional painful nodules developed over the thorax and posterior sacrum. Symptoms included persistent, sharp, sometimes radiating bone pain in the left pelvis and occipital region, along with anorexia, nausea, intermittent vomiting, mucus-containing stools, and a weight loss of 11.3 kg during the preceding 10 months. Fatigue and intermittent fevers (up to 38.3°C) with associated sweats started in the past month.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Appendectomy, tonsillectomy, hysterectomy, and bilateral oophorectomy performed in the past. No additional relevant medical history specified.
medical_history.family_history: Strong family history of cancer, including a son with Burkitt’s lymphoma, a brother with melanoma, a mother with cholangiocarcinoma and squamous-cell carcinoma, a paternal grandmother with ovarian cancer, a maternal grandfather with lung cancer, an aunt with breast cancer, and another aunt with leukemia.
medical_history.social_history: Patient smoked two packs of cigarettes per day for 15 years and drank alcohol occasionally. She was a retired real estate broker living in northern New England with her two children.
